meanings.definition: A person who opposes or resists something.
meanings.sent1: The oppositionist disagreed with the new law.
meanings.sent2: The oppositionist voiced their concerns during the meeting.
meanings.sent3: The oppositionist playfully debated their friend on the topic.
meanings.sent4: Her stubbornness made her an oppositionist to change.
meanings.sent5: The oppositionist stood firm in their beliefs.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to opposition or resistance.
meanings.sent1: The oppositionist group held a protest.
meanings.sent2: Her oppositionist views were well-known in the community.
meanings.sent3: The cat took an oppositionist stance against the vacuum cleaner.
meanings.sent4: The storm's oppositionist winds shook the trees violently.
meanings.sent5: The oppositionist tone of the speech inspired the crowd.
